alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 11 at 10:13PM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 7 PM MDT THURSDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Central Highlands and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 9 AM to 7 PM MDT Thursday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Thursday night through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized areas of blowing dust may reduce visibility Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
